intro: Agallis montana, commonly known as mountain agalinis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of North America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stem and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces tiny, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks. Agallis montana is a perennial herb that is adapted to harsh alpine environments.
